Package camzup.pfriendly

Class ZImage

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PImage
camzup.pfriendly.ZImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, processing.core.PConstants
public class ZImage
extends processing.core.PImage
An extension of PImage, specializing in color gradients and blitting text to an image.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int CHECKER_DARK
    Default color for dark checker squares, -11184811 or 1.0 / 3.0 of 255.
    static int CHECKER_LIGHT
    Default color for light checker squares, -5592406 or 2.0 / 3.0 of 255.
    static int DEFAULT_ALIGN
    Default horizontal alignment when creating an image from text: PConstants.LEFT, 37.
    static int DEFAULT_KERNING
    Default spacing between characters, in pixels, when creating an image from text: 0.
    static int DEFAULT_LEADING
    Default spacing between lines, in pixels, when creating an image from text: 8.

      public static processing.core.PImage checker​(int a, int b, int cols, int rows, processing.core.PImage target)
      Renders a checker pattern on an image for diagnostic purposes. Ideally, the image dimensions should be a power of 2 (32, 64, 128, 256, 512).
      Parameters:
      a - the first color
      b - the second color
      cols - the column count
      rows - the row count
      target - the output image

    • checker

      public static processing.core.PImage checker​(int count, processing.core.PImage target)
      Renders a checker pattern on an image for diagnostic purposes. Uses -11184811 and -5592406 as default colors.
      Parameters:
      count - the count
      target - the output image

    • conic

      public static processing.core.PImage conic​(float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float radians, Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Generates a conic gradient, where the factor rotates on the z axis around an origin point. Best used with square images; for other aspect ratios, the origin should be adjusted accordingly.
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the origin x coordinate
      yOrigin - the origin y coordinate
      radians - the angular offset
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • conic

      Parameters:

      radians - the angular offset
      grd - the gradient

      Returns:
      the image

    • dither

      public static processing.core.PImage dither​(processing.core.PImage target, Color[] palette)
      Dithers an image with the Floyd-Steinberg method. Builds an octree in CIE LAB from an input palette, then finds the nearest color according to Euclidean distance (see CIE76).
      Parameters:
      target - image
      palette - palette
      Returns:
      the image

    • falseColor

      public static processing.core.PImage falseColor​(Gradient grd, java.util.function.IntFunction<java.lang.Float> clrEval, processing.core.PImage target)
      Recolors an image in-place with a color gradient. The color is converted to a factor in [0.0, 1.0] by an evaluation function.
      Parameters:
      grd - the color gradient
      clrEval - the color evaluator
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the augmented image

    • falseColor

      public static processing.core.PImage falseColor​(Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Recolors an image in-place with a color gradient. Also known as a gradient map. The evaluation factor is the product of a pixel's luminance and its transparency.
      Parameters:
      grd - the color gradient
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the augmented image
      See Also:
      Color.sRgbLuminance(int)

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText​(processing.core.PFont font, java.lang.String text)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image.
      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet. Defaults to the fill color white.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      Returns:
      the new image

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText​(processing.core.PFont font, java.lang.String text, Color fillClr)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image.
      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      Returns:
      the new image

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText​(processing.core.PFont font, java.lang.String text, Color fillClr, int leading)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image. The leading and is measured in pixels; negative values are not allowed.

      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      leading - spacing between lines
      Returns:
      the new image

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText​(processing.core.PFont font, java.lang.String text, Color fillClr, int leading, int kerning)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image. The leading and kerning are measured in pixels; negative values are not allowed

      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      leading - spacing between lines
      kerning - spacing between characters
      Returns:
      the new image

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText​(processing.core.PFont font, java.lang.String text, Color fillClr, int leading, int kerning, int textAlign)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image. The leading and kerning are measured in pixels; negative values are not allowed. The horizontal text alignment may be either center PConstants.CENTER ( 3 ), right PConstants.RIGHT ( 39 ) or left PConstants.LEFT ( 37 ).

      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      leading - spacing between lines
      kerning - spacing between characters
      textAlign - the horizontal alignment
      Returns:
      the new image

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText​(processing.core.PFont font, java.lang.String text, int fillClr)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image.
      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      Returns:
      the new image

      the new image

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText​(processing.core.PFont font, java.lang.String text, int fillClr, int leading, int kerning, int textAlign)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image. The leading and kerning are measured in pixels; negative values are not allowed. The horizontal text alignment may be either center PConstants.CENTER ( 3 ), right PConstants.RIGHT ( 39 ) or left PConstants.LEFT ( 37 ).

      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      leading - spacing between lines
      kerning - spacing between characters
      textAlign - the horizontal alignment
      Returns:
      the new image

    • gammaAdjust

      public static processing.core.PImage gammaAdjust​(processing.core.PImage source, float gamma, float amplitude, float offset, boolean alpha)
      Adjusts gamma of an image. Raises red, green and blue to the power of the gamma; includes alpha if the flag is true. Clamps results to stay in gamut.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      gamma - the gamma
      amplitude - the amplitude
      offset - the offset
      alpha - adjust the alpha
      Returns:
      the image

    • grayscale

      public static processing.core.PImage grayscale​(processing.core.PImage target)
      Converts an image to gray scale. Does not change the image format or reduce the number of bytes used to store color; all colors remain 32-bit.
      Parameters:
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • grayscale

      public static processing.core.PImage grayscale​(processing.core.PImage target, boolean normalize)
      Converts an image to gray scale, with the option of stretching its contrast, i.e., normalizing its grays according to a minimum and maximum. Does not change the image format or reduce the number of bytes used to store color; all colors remain 32-bit.
      Parameters:
      target - the output image
      normalize - the normalization flag
      Returns:
      the image
      See Also:
      Color.sRgbLuminance(int)

    • linear

      public static processing.core.PImage linear​(float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float xDest, float yDest, Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Generates a linear gradient from an origin point to a destination point. The origin and destination should be in the range [-1.0, 1.0]. The scalar projection is clamped to [0.0, 1.0].
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the origin x coordinate
      yOrigin - the origin y coordinate
      xDest - the destination x coordinate
      yDest - the destination y coordinate
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • linear

      public static processing.core.PImage linear​(Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Generates a horizontal linear gradient.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the image

    • linear

      public static processing.core.PImage linear​(Vec2 origin, Vec2 dest, Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Generates a linear gradient from an origin point to a destination point. The origin and destination should be in the range [-1.0, 1.0]. The scalar projection is clamped to [0.0, 1.0].
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin
      dest - the destination
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • premul

      public static processing.core.PImage premul​(processing.core.PImage source)
      Multiplies the red, green and blue channels of each pixel in the image by its alpha channel.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      Returns:
      the pre-multiplied image

    • radial

      public static processing.core.PImage radial​(float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float radius, Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Generates a radial gradient. This does not account for aspect ratio, so an image that is not 1:1 will result in an ellipsoid.
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the x coordinate
      yOrigin - the y coordinate
      radius - the radius
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • radial

      public static processing.core.PImage radial​(Vec2 origin, float radius, Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Generates a radial gradient. This does not account for aspect ratio, so an image that is not 1:1 will result in an ellipsoid.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin
      radius - the radius
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • tint

      public static processing.core.PImage tint​(processing.core.PImage source, int tintClr, float fac)
      Tints an image to a color by a factor in [0.0, 1.0] . For images with alpha, the minimum alpha between the source and tint color are used.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      tintClr - the tint color
      fac - the factor
      Returns:
      the image

    • toString

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the string

    • toSvgString

      public static java.lang.String toSvgString​(processing.core.PImage source, float scale)
      Converts an image to a SVG, where a rectangle with non-zero alpha represents a pixel. Intended for use with small images in the pixel art style that need to be scaled while maintaining crisp edges.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      scale - the scale
      Returns:
      the string

    • wrap

      public static int[] wrap​(int[] source, int wSource, int hSource, int[] target, int wTarget, int dx, int dy)
      Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image's pixels, using integer floor modulo to wrap the source image. The source image can be offset horizontally and/or vertically, creating the illusion of parallax.
      Parameters:
      source - source pixel array
      wSource - source image width
      hSource - source image height
      target - target pixel array
      wTarget - target image width
      dx - horizontal pixel offset
      dy - vertical pixel offset
      Returns:
      the target pixels

    • wrap

      public static processing.core.PImage wrap​(processing.core.PImage source, processing.core.PImage target, float dx, float dy)
      Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image's pixels, using integer floor modulo to wrap the source image. The source image can be offset horizontally and/or vertically, creating the illusion of parallax.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
      dx - horizontal pixel offset
      dy - vertical pixel offset
      Returns:
      the image

    • wrap

      public static processing.core.PImage wrap​(processing.core.PImage source, processing.core.PImage target, int dx, int dy)
      Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image's pixels, using integer floor modulo to wrap the source image. The source image can be offset horizontally and/or vertically, creating the illusion of parallax.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
      dx - horizontal pixel offset
      dy - vertical pixel offset

      the image

      public static processing.core.PImage wrap​(processing.core.PImage source, processing.core.PImage target, Vec2 d)

      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
